page.title: 07Primary School in Kirkcaldy
page.content: In our area there are five Primary schools called Capshard, Dunearn, Fair Isle, Torbain and Valley. Altogether there are 2428 pupils and 108 teachers. The pupil population is falling. The average number of pupils in a class is 30. Three of the schools have nursery classes attached.The standard of behaviour is really very good but may be deteriorating. There are three or four computers in each school and they are hoping for another. The computers are used for making up quizzes,following up maths work or using an adventure program fo language.The school day is spent on Language ,Mathematics, Environmental Studies and the Aesthetic subjects all of which may be combined in a theme or project.
